title.narrative: Improving HIV Service Outcomes through Strengthening Human Resources Management

description.narrative: This project builds on the achievements of the USAID global CapacityPlus project in the Dominican Republic to strengthen human resources management systems at the Ministry of Health (MOH), Ministry of Public Administration, and with other stakeholders to provide and sustain high-quality HIV/AIDS services. The project works to improve the distribution of health workers across the country, to improve performance management by finalizing and supporting implementation of the performance management system, and to improve maternal and child health services, particularly elimination of maternal-to-child transmission of HIV services, at priority hospitals

•Distribution of health workers. With support from IntraHealth, national stakeholders will improve the distribution of health workers so that they are strategically deployed to provide HIV services where they are most needed. The project will use the Workload Indicators of Staffing Need (WISN) approach to build the evidence base that will inform these decisions. WISN calculates the number of each type of health worker (such as nurses and pharmacists) that are needed in a particular health facility, based on the facility’s workload. •Performance management system. The project will finalize and support implementation of a national performance-management system to improve HIV care and treatment. •Maternal and child health. The third activity focuses on improving HIV services for maternal and child health at priority hospitals, strengthening the information system for perinatal care, and ensuring its use in clinical management.
